entries.content: Be prepared to answer direct questions comparing your solution to competitors, such as 'what makes you better than all the others?'
entries.notes: This is a common competitive objection setup requiring unique value articulation.

entries.content: Attempting to differentiate based on ease of use or user-friendliness when asked about competitors: 'even if you're not good impulsive data into a CRM system ours is a good one'.
entries.notes: An example of attempting unique value framing without attacking, though the phrasing is weak.

focus_area: Competitive Objections: Unique value framing without attacking others
